Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: moretravel2Bhad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a tour. I am glad I had not booked in for any longer. Unfortunatelly we had a room which was in a block away from the main building so we had to walk in the rain to our room. Our room was just inside the main door of the unit block so when the main door was closed at night time everyone was knocking on that door for others to let them in as there are no handles on the outside. There were people who were going out for a smoke and constantly locking themselves out and knocking and calling to their friends. It was very noisy. Not much sleep so was glad to be checking out. The breakfast was good and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average... Good value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: Sandra12blue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 6 days and picked this hotel as it was cheap and outskirts of Rome. Our room was clean, neat and small. We spent very minimal time in the Hotel. Would leave by 7am and get back very late in the evening. We spent our time exploring this magnificent city. We did have a break day and my son spent the day swimming in the hotel pool and my husband and I lazed around having drinks by the pool. The hotel is standard, it was perfect for us .... I'm certainly surprised by all the negative reviews :(

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sally_B54
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 12pm to be advised that there was no room service or bar facilities (after 15hrs travelling) Also the night porter quite abrupt and did not offer to show us to our room even though we had to leave hotel and walk 2 blocks in the dark. No room service the next day or any hotel facilities as they were "closed" (???) This is no way a 4 * I would advise a recheck on the hotel as it is not good. All of the rooms had there balcony closed off and prison like bars all over. Vile!! Then to add insult to injury I left my engagement ring & eternity ring on the desk in my room. Contacted them immediatley to be told that there was nothing in my room!!!! Not happy! :( I have never given a poor review before, but this was the worst EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: footsoreinlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Jan 2012 and although the initial impression is that of a motel, the hotel has been refurbished to a good standard. The room was spotless with a nice firm bed, satellite TV with chanels from all over Europe, mini-bar, very useful for my own snacks (does anyone ever pay for overpriced items provided by hotels?!) I came prepared with mini travel kettle and tea-bags as past experience revealed that tea-trays are not always provided in Italy. The bed was firm and comfortable. It was clearly a newly-decorated room as there was still a bit of masking tape around a light fitting!The bathroom was very nice - all marble with powerful shower. We found the staff in reception friendly, though not all of them spoke very good English - but we believe in trying to use the local lingo, however painful it might be to local ears. There were maps and posters about tours. The breakfast was varied and plentiful with lovely fresh rolls and good coffee although the quality of the juice was disappointing (overly sweet and probably made up from dried or concentrated mix - sad in a country that produces delicious citrus fruits. Lots of different pastries, cheese, salami and not very good ham. The restaurant advertised a 2-course meal with mineral water for 15 Euros, with specialities from a different Italian region each evening. We didn't get to try it during our stay but it sounds very good value, bearing in mind typical Rome restaurant prices. It is not easy to get to the hotel from the airport by public transport. You can either get the Express train (expensive, takes 30 mins) into the centre, then go out again on the metro + walk or bus, or take a shuttle bus. Shuttle bus prices vary tremendously, as does the time they take. If you don't want to pay for the Express train, you have to get the stopping train, get off at Ostiense station, then change to the nearby Metro station, which confusingly has a different name, 'Piramide', then get the Metro to Palasport. The hotel is set back a bit from a very busy 6-lane road, but the traffic noise wasn't too intrusive. Overall, a nice, comfortable hotel and you have to weigh up the good price against convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: Hajnal I
Reviews.Content: Reasonable location, easy comute to central Rome. Reception and lobby area were uninviting, staff indifferent and the bar was never open during 3 day stay, with no explanation as to why. Breakfast buffet selection limited. This hotel was represented as a 4 star, however in reality it was more a 2 or 2,5 stars, with good rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Dessy_Mark
Reviews.Content: Location. This hotel was really on the outskirts of Rome, we had to take a bus which took 5 minutes to the metro (don't forget to add about 20+ mins wait for the bus to turn up) and then we had to get the tube from there. On the was back from the metro station you still had to wait a couple of minutes for the bus but this time it takes about 15-20 minutes to get you back to the hotel as it goes through a different route. The bus stops are very near by the hotel. There was a massive mall next to the hotel where we went to get dinner each evening as we were worried that we might miss the last train/bus (they don't run very late). The lobby: The lobby was nice and looked quite posh. There were plenty of sofas and sitting areas. Most of the receptionists spoke good English but they weren't exactly friendly apart from 1 - Sergio. He went out of his way all the time! So I suppose he made up for the rest! We never received any information about any tours or any activities going on. On the very last day they put up some posters and when we required about them they said they were always on there - well no, they weren't. Cleanliness: I have always been happy with a comfy bed and a clean bathroom to have a shower and rest after exploring all day. For a 4* hotel I would expect to at least have a clean bathroom and clean floors. We stayed for 4 nights. When we checked in the room was not clean to begin with, there was rubbish on the floor and hairs all over the bath, sink and toilet! I cleaned the shower myself so we could use it. There is very poor ventilation as there are no windows in the bathroom so there is mold on the tiles and the shower curtain. Also the bins were emptied but if there was rubbish around the bins it was not collected or cleaned. It wasn't anything major, but it was not pleasant and did not have that luxury you see in their pictures and descriptions. Beds: I give the bed 10 out of 10 for comfort! Very comfortable and clean white bedding! However we did not have a proper duvet but instead we had some old blankets which did not smell nice! Room: The room was very spacious and it had everything you could possibly need for a short break. Prices: EXPENSIVE! Nothing is free. To use the Wi-Fi you had to pay 6 euro for 12 hours or 6 euro to use their computer in the lobby for 1 hour! The mini bar prices were ridiculous, small bottle of mineral water was 3.50 and a can of coke was 4.50 euros. The restaurant had a special deal which was 15 euros for 3 course meal, I personally did not think the dinner was that good and definitely not worth the money. Breakfast: The breakfast was very early 6:30am until 9:45am and weekends it was 6:30 until 10am. 10 out of 10! Had very good choice of variates - croissants, donuts, biscuits, yogurts, different bread buns, cold meat (ham,cheese and salami) toast, all sorts of jam and honey. Amazing coffee, but rubbish juices! I do believe the red orange and the pineapple were supposed to be concentrated with water. It did not taste right to us at all Swimming pool: As we went in early January, the swimming pool was covered up and not in use. It looked rather small, so I wouldn't be surprised if the pictures that were shown on the website are not the actual pictures of the hotel's swimming pool. Overall I would personally not go back and I would not recommended for any of my friends or family. Don't forget you have to pay a City Tax of 3 euros per person per night when you check out. If you stay in a 3* or lower hotel you will pay 2. I know its just a euro but every penny counts especially in overpriced Rome! At the end of the day I do not believe this is a 4* hotel. So if you are planning to go ahead and book it don't have your hopes up too high and do not be fooled by the pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: StormyIllinois
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as rated, average. Because so far out of Rome the rooms were a little larger than you will find in Rome center.( The rates reflect the distance and the effort it takes to get around.Transportation to Rome was easy, yet you need to take a bus( about a block away) to the subway.( about a 30 minute or better trip..) The breakfast buffet was very good and large variety of items..

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Halima R
Reviews.Content: good location 15minutes from every where take the bus from the front to firmi b metro and in5 minutes you can reach any piazza u want its very easy

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice of Trafalgar Tours”
Reviews.Author: CBGolfers
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel we stayed in while on Trafalgar tours. Rooms were large and very comfortable. Since it was our last day in Italy, we did not have the opportunity to eat dinner there. We did have breakfast, which was okay. It was pretty far from the historic district, but only about a 15 minute drive to the airport. Worth staying at if you want someting close to airport. It also has its own grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cool”
Reviews.Author: Catherine Ann B
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I had some qualms about this hotel, and emailed to request a quiet room with a double bed. Though we had no response I mentioned my email on arrival and we were very happy with the room allocated, although the double bed had two single mattresses. It was very clean and the furnishings of good quality, though there was no outdoor furniture for the large balcony. Our room was in a separate block from the main hotel building, so although we were not disturbed by the neighbouring shopping centre deliveries, the view was across to the extensive shopping centre parking with some very modern blocks in the background, but not as unattractive as you may suppose from this description. The bathroom was small but had a very powerful shower over the bath, though this was merely regulated by the bath taps. The air-conditioning was excellent. The dining room was pleasant, but apart from breakfast which was uninspiring but plentiful, with a fairly wide continental choice, after hot days in Rome we ate in the Euroma 2 centre previously mentioned, mostly choosing the two cafés which offered good, authentic Italian food, though there were plenty of places like McDonalds offering cheaper alternatives. Transport links - a five minute bus ride to the metro and then 20 minutes into Rome - were good and very frequent, though often overcrowded at the end of the afternoon, and there seems to be no limit to the number of people allowed to board an already crowded bus! That was the worst part for me, though nothing to do with the hotel. The dual carriageway at the end of the hotel's drive wasn't a problem as there is an underpass at the foot of the steps leading down to the shopping centre entrance. Although the hotel premises are kept very clean, the large dustbins at the end of this drive are not very welcoming. My husband took advantage of the pool, but said it was like swimming in untreated tap water, and was disappointed that it was not opened before ten in the morning, as he likes an early morning dip. And now a warning! We were not made aware by the travel company through which we booked this hotel that an accommodation tax was to be paid before we left, which was rather a shock as it amounted to 48 euros for the two of us. Also, even though I asked for receipts for that and the payment of the car to the airport, no receipt was forthcoming. However I didn't find the staff unhelpful, though obviously busy. Overall, though, from our experience I can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The pool is not so grandeur- but value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ital-Aussie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its value for money, and more paraticularly the pool. I have stayed in Rome a number of times so it didnt bother me that this hotel was a little out of central Rome. It was not so difficult to catch a bus and train into the centre Rome, which took about 30 minutes. The hotel was next door to large shopping centre. The hotel room was ok, and I found breakfast good, as with the staff were friendly. The photos of the pool however are very misleading, you would be struggling to find any greenery or trees for that matter. The pool area was quite small. In saying the above, it was still good value for money, it depends what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room tiny pool”
Reviews.Author: Jergio
Reviews.Content: To our disappointment, the pool is much smaller than we expected and so as the room. The breakfast is poor. In my opinion, it's just a very average hotel. It doesn't worth the price we've paid. May be the only good point is that they provide a private parking area and it's next to a big shopping mall Euroma 2.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* quality and dubious info re taxis...”
Reviews.Author: AndreSUk
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff in reception - not helpful and condescending. Pool too small and had to pay for towels there. Terrible breakfast quality and all self-service: orange juice not fresh and too sweet; coffee from machine and too strong; cornflakes were cheap and nasty. Not helpful re duration of trip from there to Ciampino airport via taxi and cost. All we got was 'it depends on the traffic how long it takes to the airport'. They were keen to promote a 'limousine' to the airport for a fixed price of 45 euros - this turned out to be a normal 4-door saloon car and the journey took 11 minutes at 8.30 am!!! We felt conned. The only positive was that it was directly next door to the Europa2 indoor shopping mall - a really good quality place. 20 mins walk to the nearest metro - this was not a problem - it was a nice walk past the 'Centro dello sport' and getting into the city was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: theAndersens
Reviews.Content: This is a frank review. Although we know this hotel is a little bit far from everything, we chosed it because of the swimming pool. It had looked good in the promotional photos. We soon found out that our choice had not been very clever. The pool was okay, nothing spectacular in the surroundings and we even had to rent towels. The staff at the reception are unfriendly. Our room which was facing a shopping center car park looked worn and tired. It has a small balcony but the balcony was very dusty, looked as if it has not been cleaned for a few months. The bathroom is compact. The morning breakfast is the same for all the 4 mornings we were there. Hard buns, cold unfresh croissants, cheap cakes, 2 kinds of same meat slices every morning ...... However, I must say that the coffee machine has done justice. It gives hot normal coffee, cuppacino and warm milk. Location wise, one has to take a bus (in front of hotel) to Euro Fermi station, then take a metro into city center. You may have to change metro lines depending on where you want to go. Once you get the hang of the public transportation, it is not so much a hassle to travel around. Remember to buy a couple of transportation tickets at one euro. You can buy them at stations and also at another hotel kiosk situated about half a km away. The Cristoforo Colombo hotel has one very good advantage. There is a shopping center Euroma located next to it so in the evenings, if you find it a bit too much to take bus and metro into town, you can just go to the many restaurants in the shopping center. For us, we do not think that we will book this hotel again the next we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: anushina
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. The reason was free parking because we had a rental car. You can't drive in Rome historic center w/o special sticker so we had to stay in business center of Rome. We like the amenities and the location. There's a big mall behind it and a sports arena 15 walk. Breakfast was great and the room had an American plug to charge the laptop and use flat hair iron:) To get to historic center you need to take a bus and a train (subway), or taxi (if you want to pay 20-30 euro). The walk to the train is 20-30 minutes (just walk towards the sports complex and by the big metallic monument turn right) but the bus (across from the hotel) will take you there in 5 min. I think, the train and buses work till 11 pm, so if you want to party in Rome after that, you'll have to take a taxi ride back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: JenGary
Reviews.Content: front of house staff very unhelpful the chamber maids are very nice and efficient so is 1 waiter at breakfast other than that not willing to help and give the impression they have better thing to do than help you out the rooms were basic with TV, toiletries hairdryer and phone. the hotel rooms are cozy and nice and dark as they have shutters on the windows The location is about 30 mins walk to the 1st Metro and 2 mins for a bus but they are hard to get They have a pool but it was not open as it was in March visited The Hotel was well swept and maintained inside and out

Reviews.Title: “there is always one that spoils it”
Reviews.Author: sambamjam
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 1pm in the afternoon to check in, the rooms were not ready yet so the reception guys gave us directions to get a drink and a bite to eat. Once Checked in the rooms were fantastic lovely and clean , very comfortable beds. We asked reception on the best way to get into Rome to do some sightseeing, and they were really helpful, they told us that prking in Rome is free on a Sunday, which was fab as we were gonna get the train or bus. We came back to the hotel in the evening to have the set meal for 15euros, we went into the resturant upstairs we sat down and waited 10 minutes for the menu, placed our order for the set meals, when the lasagne came out it was luke warm but edible especially as we were hungry from all the walking around in Rome. We then waited a further 30 mins for second course which was 2 pieces of roast pork and side plate of carrots in butter, very disapointing, the meat was freezing it was as if the chef had forgot to heat it up, we asked the waiter to take the plate back and warm up the meat so they did. 10 mins later it came out full of steam as we asked for it to be re heated, when it was time for deserts 3 of us placed our order when i turned to see whatmy friend wanted i was faced with a plate flung on the table at me and him walking away. We spoke to the managaer and his was very apologetic, the Hotel was fantastic its just a shame that it was let down by the meal, oh and the bar should have opened at 4pm but it had to stay closed as they were short staffed in the resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Motel more than hotel in the suburbs”
Reviews.Author: cbell120
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. AC was unserviceable. Refuse our request for extra stand for our second suite case. One per room only! Location is far from downtown but next to a mall, bus stop and on to the metro. Travel to downtown approx. 30 minutes. Facilities are clean. Front desk staff friendly. Breakfast included. Paid 600 US for 4 nights. This is a 3 star hotel at max.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BAA5000
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a nice place to sleep after visiting rome.The breakfast was included and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Location Only Problem”
Reviews.Author: wigsterReading
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel having read through the reviews of several places in Rome. The initial reaction on arriving (in the dark, about 10pm) was that it appeared to be in a bit of a dodgy location. Daylight brought a slightly different opinion, but it certainly seems to be well away from any local shops (but does back on to an enormous shopping mall - Euroma 2). I was a bit surprised at how far the walk to the Metro station was - it's certainly not the 5-10 minutes some of the other reviews seemed to suggest, probably more like 20-25. The trick with this was to get a weeks ticket from the Metro station, which gives you bus travel as well. There's then about 5 buses that pretty much run between the Metro and the hotel, but be a bit careful about which ones you get back - only three of them stop right outside the hotel. The Metro itself is probably about 20 minutes into the city centre, but we did struggle a bit with the Termini station, where the two Metro lines cross over. There's a lot of building work going on, and you have to take some major detours when swapping between the lines. The hotel itself was nice and clean, although the TV channels are somewhat limited, and while wi-fi is available, it was 6 Euro for a 24 hour card. The room had working aircon, window shutters, and a little balcony (but unfortunately it overlooked the car park and the back of the shopping centre!) We didn't have any dinners there, but breakfast was more than adequate. The staff were very friendly, and as ever most of them were English speaking. If you don't want to eat in the hotel (I think the evening meals were about 20 euro), there are lots of food places in the shopping mall, which are open till 10pm. Prices there seemed to be about 10 Euro for a main course. Overall, I'd be happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “good, notning special”
Reviews.Author: TenM
Reviews.Content: Situated close to the highway around Rome. Public transfer to the center of Rome is a bit complicated, first bus and than metro. The hotel itself is nice, as well as the staff, but the rooms are in seperate buildings, so its more like a motel. The pool is nice but a bit outside the hotel as well. Around the hotel is a shopping mall and its parkings. Noisy rooms with a balcony. Nice hotel to stay for one night... if you you want to visit Rome, better go to a hotel nearer to the center or a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: senoritaLimerick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is too difficult to get to for anyone going on a trip to Rome. It is behind a petrol station and there are no other services nearby. you have to walk to the shop to get a ticket for the bus, then take the bus to the metro. It is ten stops to the centre of Rome on the metro. While the rooms were lovely and the pool a fantastic advantage in the heat, this hotel is only suitable for a stop off point for bus tours on their way to another destination. Also the staff are not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: elle074
Reviews.Content: I go to Rome quiet often, about once a month, and stay overnight, both for business and pleasure. I stayed in this hotel last night and I swear I will never ever go back or recommend it! When we arrived we missed it the first time as its in a little side street and not visible from the road, so we had to go around and try to find the right turning into the hotel. The staff at check in were indifferent but that's almost normal in 4* hotels in Rome so I passed no notice. They gace us room 146. If they ever give you room 146 ask for a different room straight away! The room (and all the 140 and 160 rooms face onto a loading /unloading dock for the shopping centre next door and there were lorries, bin/garbage trucks (and their sirens and harzard sounds) ALL night! To make matters worst the shopping centres PA (public announcement) system started at 8 am. The room, for a superior double was small, as was the bathroom. The bathroom had a very strong mouldy smell which was disturbing. The room was HOT we turned off the heating and opened the windows to try and cool down the room. It didn't work, the heater didn't go off and the room didn't cool down. We turned on the air conditioning and the heater blew out even hotter air. It made us feel ill and together with the continuous passing of trucks and horns and sirens it made for a very stressful and sleepless night. Breakfast. What Breakfast? What they offer as a "continental breakfast" is below one star levels never mind the 4 stars this hotel claims to have and which I will be looking into how they got 4 stars as this was in no way a 4 star hotel! We were planning to stay until Sunday but came home today instead (we had booked only for last night thankfully) I will never go back there and the only good point about this hotel is its closeness to the Palasport, which is used for sporting events and concerts and the reason of my chosing this hotel. If you are a tourist please chose a hotel closer to the centre, you might pay a little more but you'll sleep well, eat well and be in a central location without trucks, overheating heaters, and a shopping centre in your room!

Reviews.Title: “It's Rome not Vegas.. This is a Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: thebravozulu
Reviews.Content: Very supprised and happy with this hotel. My wife and I went to a Dave Matthews concert at Euro Palasport (indoor Stadium in Rome) and this hotel was only a 5 minute walk from the concert hall and 10 minute walk from the Metro (Euro Palasport). THERE IS A 3 STORY MALL DIRECTLY BEHIND THIS HOTEL. GREAT MALL!!! My full review is as follows: - Reservations were made online at a fast pace with a 25% discount. - Information on the website was correct in eery way, no leading on.. - Email recieved after onlin traction, almost instantaniously with hotel information and directions. - Check-in at the hotel desk was 10 seconds. Reservations were in the book, no hassels (I never show to a hotel with my reservation just to see if they are on their game). - Information Available at the front desk. - Concierge has action langage skills - Italian, English, and German. - Capacity of hotel is over 100 rooms. - Check-out was as fast as check-in. - No room check (they took your word for what you took from the mini-fridge) - Room was very clean. - Beautifully decorated. - Very comfortable setting. - Full size bath with heated towel rack, continuous hot water, marble everything, and very clean. - Room is large for a European Hotel Room. - Hard wood floors - Safe in room. - Extra pillows and blankets in room. - Cable in three languages (Italian, English, and German) - Breakfast comes with room - Good European Breakfast. Only suggestion for this hotel: Lower your mini-fridge prices! A TRUE FOUR STAR HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, not so great location.”
Reviews.Author: CanTravel4ever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice hotel. Definitely worth the four stars is has. The lobby is beautiful, as are the dining rooms. The breakfast served was nothing to write home about, but average for what you'll find in Italian hotels. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. There is a pool there, but it was closed at the time of year we went. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in the Hotel Cristoforo Colombo for five nights, and were scheduled to stay there for our last night in Italy before flying back to Toronto. When we arrived at the hotel to check in the day before our last, we were informed that the hotel had over-booked, and that they would be paying for a cab for us to go to another four star hotel in the area, where the bill will already be taken care of for us. Although it was a less than ideal situation they handled it very well, and the entire ordeal only took about an hour out of our trip. My only complaint about this hotel is that it is quite far from the rest of rome. I had read many reviews before booking, and assumed that the people were exaggerating the walk to the subway station, but it is quite far. You can take the Blue Line subway and get off at EUR Fermi which is the closest station. From there you can take a bus (I can't remember which number bus) that will take you within a few minutes walk from the hotel. We arrived in Rome on a Sunday, when there were no buses running, and it took us about 30 minutes to walk to the hotel (and my wife and I are both very fit people). If not for the location I would have no issues staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A practical solution when on transit in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mywhereabouts
Reviews.Content: Together with my husband and my teenage children I've spent one night at the Cristoforo Colombo Hotel before leaving to Prague in January 2010. As mentioned in my title it is a comfortable accommodation if you live on an island or very far from the airport you need to reach, as it is located near an exit of the Grande Raccordo Anulare (the ringroad around Rome connecting to the highway) but not directly on the traffic-congested main road (named Cristoforo Colombo). In fact, it is around 50 m inside on a private area and this gives you the immediate feeling of a quite tranquil place to rest. Check-in is quite brief but not particularly warm. As the resort is formed by several buildings inside this private area (with parking area free of charge in a back-yard), the receptionist will explain you in which one is your room, but nobody will accompany you nor bring your luggage into your room, which is decidedly strange for a 4-star hotel. However, rooms are objectively small for the 4-star category but well decorated and quite comfortable (a good number of international SAT-channels is also available). Equally small but comfortable and well-equipped are the bathrooms. Considering the cheap rate (due to a last minute booking) we paid, all in all the accommodation was good value for money, but not the hotel location, as problems arise when you go to bed: vehicle circulation is allowed throughout the various buildings, so you'll spend part of your night being awaken by motorbikes or cars just outside your window as well as other guests arriving late in the night and laughing and making a loud noise as if it was midday! Furthermore, the hotel restaurant already closes at 21:30 hrs and if you get this information from the receptionist and have just arrived at the hotel, nobody will tell you that almost all of the restaurants in the neighbourhood of the hotel are closing by 22:00 hrs! You'll discover it personally but you'll be able to find somewhere on foot a few restaurants still open in the middle distance. The breakfast buffet is among the positive features of the Cristoforo Colombo Hotel: a wide, bright restaurant room with many buffets (continental and British breakfast, i.e. a large variety of sweet and salt food) are available with warm & cold beverages - though no yogurt nor fresh fruit. Among the disappointing aspects a significant role is played by the internet connection: it's on charge (OK, no problem, if the service is adequate) but very, very bad, as admitted by the receptionists too. You'll waste most of your time in unsuccessful temptations of connecting yourself and then will give it simply up! The internet point available near the reception averages at the same terrible level. The hotel management is trying to improve the quality level of this service but it seems to be more difficult than foreseen. All in all, some positive aspects but also some handicaps which can be tolerated, in my point of view, if you pay a special cheap rate but would get me quite angry in the case I would pay the very expensive official rates shown on the back of my room door!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Roxu83
Reviews.Content: We spend here 4 nights during the New Year's Eve. The hotel is very nice and the only bad thing about it is the location which is a little far from the center of Rome, but in 30 minutes you are at Spanish Steeps. The breakfast was OK, as like others said it is more than just a continental one. It has near also a big mall. EUROMA 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service-don't be fooled by the reviews”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella2009
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the reviews. This hotel is very nice. The rooms are comfortable, a great patio and beautiful bathroom (lovely large tub and strong water pressure) the service is exquisite and there is a nice free breakfast (more than continental) includes hot foods like eggs and ham. Fresh fruit, cereal bar and a ton of pastries. The hotel is a little out of the center but not far at all. you can literally walk one block from the hotel to get to the bus which runs very often. The front desk will provide you with metro and bus maps as well as a map of Rome (one of the best maps you can find). Take the bus to EUR FERMI and you are at the metro line that will take you into the center The hotel has internet kiosks so you can keep in touch - the internet card costs only 5 euros for 1 hour- just enough to send an email a day to your loved ones. I loved this hotel and would definately stay here again. There is a great spanish/italian club across the club - Il Tucano, where we spent our first night meeting some locals and dancing the night away.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: delineation
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night with my boyfriend just last week. The location is hard to find, as it’s right off a major highway, and is tucked in behind a gas station. From the outside it looks more like a motel and on the inside it resembles a 2-3 star rather than a 4 star. The reception staff get the job done, but they’re not necessarily pleasant. The rooms are fairly spacious and clean, but I didn’t know how to work the door/window so it was dark, but that’s my fault. The bathroom looked very nice but the shower went hot and cold on us, in the morning and at night. I always hate when that happens and would not expect that from a 4 star, or even a 3 star. We didn’t use the pool but it looked okay. Looked 20 times better in the promo pictures though. It’s a 15 minute bus and train ride to the Colusseum, if you want to wait half an hour for the bus, that is. We went out during the day and got back to the area around 10pm, and we were hungry. We walked around for half an hour looking for a place to eat, and just found one seedy little bar. There is nothing around there except for the mall, which was closed by then…so we starved until breakfast that morning. Breakfast was stardard. Not great. Not bad. Given the number of tour buses in the parking lot, it appears lots of tour companies use this hotel, in which case, the location wouldn’t really matter. The Pro: There is a great mall right beside it, the Euroma 2. The mall is big and has lots of great stores, and even a grocery store that’s like a Walmart Supercentre. Other pros….nope. Okay, it’s cheap.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but!!”
Reviews.Author: Tecomagirl
Reviews.Content: After a fabulous tour of Italy we arrrived at this hotel, it was ok, roms a bit smal for triple share, Only negative were the staff, very rude, if they continue to use students on the front desk make sure they are trained in customer service, also the breakfast staff were rude, if they don't like their jobs let someone else have them. I only asked one question and was told in no uncertain terms to wait while they answered the phone. I had paid for an extra night and now wish I hadn't bothered

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, bad service”
Reviews.Author: LAKOMARBELLA
Reviews.Content: good value for money regarding accommodation, the room was clean, had a comfty bed and great parkin just outside the room. Now, everything outside the room was quite of a disappointment, the staff was not very friendly, the breakfast buffet did not have much variety(nothing warm, not even bacon and eggs), the bar was small (only 3 tables). Another downset would have been its decoration, it looked so 80's i couldnt believe it was refurbished in 2003. in conclusion, great value for money regarding accommodation, nothing great outside of it.

Reviews.Title: “Out of Town........OK Hotel..!”
Reviews.Author: City-Break-Freak
Reviews.Content: Reading several reviews (after I had booked) I was a little worried about what I would find. I needn't have been. Although the exterior gave the impression of a third rate motel, the lobby was bright with a small bar and seating areas. The staff were helpful and business-like and spoke good english. The rooms were clean if a little sparsly furnished and the bathroom boasted a very powerful shower. We only stayed a couple of nights and we ate in the restaurant both nights. Food was a reasonable quality for a tourist hotel and at 14 Euros for the set menu I couldn't complain too much. Now comes the thing that might put a few people off.... Yes, it's the location. It's well out of town but the transport links were good. The bus stop is about 300 meters up the street and we didn't wait longer than 10 minutes for the bus (777, 071, 709, 705) These all go to the little bus terminal at EUR Fermi Metro station. Take my tip and buy a travel card, 4 Euros a day or 11 Euros for 3 days, this gets you on all metro and buses. Hop on a train and within 20 minutes we were at Termini station, change trains to the A line and another 10 minutes saw us standing on the Spanish Steps. Back to the location of the hotel, it is on a very busy main road but I guess if you're in town all day then this won't bother you. The shopping centre, newly built next door, gives the opportunity for a bit of retail therapy if you're really desperate in an idle half hour. All in all, for the traveller willing to "get stuck in" with the transport system, for the money you would do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Insight vacation hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeonetteS
Reviews.Content: We traveled with Insight vactions and there was black mold all over the bathroom. We were supposed to have access to a restaurant as part of our tour, but the hotel restaurant was closed for a private party both nights we were there - so we had to walk out in the rain several blocks to get something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A nice outside in the outskirts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Wilde_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cristoforo Colombo on June 28th, 2008 - at the very end of our 10-day bus tour of Italy. I have to say that we didn't spend much time at the hotel. But, what we saw was nice. The lobby is large, clean, and well-decorated. Then, we walked to a separate building to go to our room. We had a first floor room that was really nice. Good size, clean - everything you could ask for. The bathroom was also nice, clean, and modern. That evening we went for a drink at the outdoor bar, which is located next to the pool. That was a really pleasant experience - so nice to sit outside on a warm, summer evening. The hotel's location is probably its biggest downfall. It is in the suburbs of Rome - to tell you the truth I really don't know where we were in relation to "downtown" and all of the tourist attractions. There is a brand new shopping mall that just went up next door. We didn't visit it, but those who did said that it was very nice. It is certainly convenient, if nothing else!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicole111
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the review I am surprised. We stayed at this hotel and loved it. It was clean, well furnished, had a great bathtub after a long day of sight seeing. We found the breakfast good, who wants a heavy meal in the heat they get there anyway with a full day of sightseeing ahead of you. There is a fabulous restraunt across the street at the end of the block...its a restraunt by day and turns into a night club at night and it was fun to go for dinner and then watch the locals come in at night to unwind. It was a bit far from the metro where you had to buy tickets but it was a nice walk, and we learnt quickly to buy enough tickets for a couple days on your first trip to the metro then the bus is just down the road.....very easy to get around on.

Reviews.Title: “It's just a stopping point”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop during our Trafalgar tour and as many other people have said, it is way out of town and there is nothing close by. Since I had read other reviews before leaving, I was prepared and picked up a large sandwich and snacks during one of our bus stops on the way into Rome. The rooms were nice and comfortable with a large bathroom and very clean. It is close to the airport and met our needs. When the mall is completed, that should give people staying there other options, but it looked like there was still a lot to be done.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ConnieR
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that I stayed here during the last night of a group tour. This hotel had the most comfortable beds I found during my 2 weeks in Italy. Of course, the location isn't great for sightseeing, but when I was there, a big shopping mall was being built right next door. At least there will be something near the hotel when that's finished. I'd recommend this place especially if you want to stay a night near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away...”
Reviews.Author: JamesChin
Reviews.Content: Other reviews of this hotel have been fairly negative and this one will be no exception. This hotel is quite far from the sights of Rome. You have to walk to the tobacconist shop to travel tickets first, then board the bus to the train station. The train station is the 2nd last from the end. To travel to the Spanish Steps would take about 45 mins. The Romans certainly know how to grafitti the outside of trains!! After having dinner out, we returned to the train station to catch the bus at around 10pm. Be cautioned that this does not feel like a particularly safe area. ie, not many people around, could not find a cab, fairly dark, and just hoping the bus would turn up. But having said that, the hotel staff were able to give us a useful map and a sheet with some basic travel instructions - and we were able to get around fairly well. Just remember that when getting the bus back to the hotel from the train station, go to the same spot where you were dropped off. It can be confusing as there are many bus stands in different locations (upstairs and downstairs) all around that station. The breakfast here is also very, very basic. They have bread, cheese and ham. After travelling across Italy and enjoying a hot breakfast, we found the food here to be disappointing. The hotel itself was not too bad. The rooms were clean and comfy. It does face onto a major road, and on the left side (facing the hotel from the road) is some major building construction. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jorgemb
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean rooms. Cons: No access to public transportation. We had to walk approximately one mile just to buy tickets. Rooms were next to driveway with tour busses coming in and out through the night. Staff was mostly indifferent and disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: trip_head
Reviews.Content: Again reading other people's reviews we were a bit cautious about booking this hotel but due to a low budget we had no other choice. We knew before we got there that it was quite far away from the city centre so the 30 min taxi journey from the train station came as no suprise - neither did the bus and train journey into town. Staff were not overly friendly but who really cares about them anyway?? They gave us all the information we asked for. Rooms were nice and clean, nice little bar by the pool. Definately value for money, shame about location. Tried to persuade my girlfriend to invite in a 'lady of the night' who we seen close to hotel but with no luck....lol.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Prop-Jet
Reviews.Content: I bought a ticket to Rome and give it as a gift to my girlfriend. On Internet this hotel looked very cozy and romantic so I were looking forward. I did not care its quite far from the city center, we had a car. First at all! - We landed about 12 and we got the hotel after 3 hours even its 20 minute drive from hotel. This hotel is located in such a hole that it took me about 20 times to drive just next to it before I found it. I was expecting something absolutely different. Its beetween two fuel stations, very cheap looking hotel, with small and dirty pool almost on the road. The stuff was really unfriendly, breakfest like nothing. It absolutely doesnt worth the price and it absolutely cannot say its 4star hotel. No way! Second at all!!! - right next to the hotel, about 2 meters from our smelly room they are building huge commercial complex. DONT COME HERE, you will hate it. Martin

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way!”
Reviews.Author: prozac
Reviews.Content: Yes it is out of the way but for the price you wont get closer to Rome! It really is a place just to rest your head, shower and then your out the door exploring beautiful Rome, why spend big bucks for accomodation when your out most of the day! I do agree it has its disadvantages for transport as you have to cross the motorway to get to the bus stop and then the metro(train) but hey its all in the experience. The rooms were very clean and the staff friendly although they couldnt help me use the internet as they didnt know how....but there were other internet cafes around! For the price it was reasonable.....i used the pool which was very clean, and soon it will be a sought after place as a huge shopping centre is being built next door.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: travelledTheWorld33
Reviews.Content: Rome: Fantastic, Hotel not so fantastic. The location was that much of a problem, although Rome was 30 mins away, traveling by the Metro was relatively easy. The hotel was not so good. The restaurant is not open for lunch, Room service was non existent, as the Dinner menu could have been much better. The reception staff were not so friendly, they just grunted when asked questions. The bar staff on the other hand were much friendlier. The rooms were like a standard Travel Inn. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “far far away”
Reviews.Author: klchuston
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice but staff needs improvement. Asked for a wake up call and never got it. Scheduled a tour and was charge a shuttle fee to get back to the hotel. Hotel is far from everything. Front desk told us to go across the street to another hotel to get bus tickets. they didn't have them either. Bus terminal was far. Nothing really within walking distance. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone wanting to see rome unless the rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “The bad reviews are wrong in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Chris017
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel, having read the terrible reviews beforehand. We have travelled extensively all around the world and having stayed in some grim accommodation, I cannot, for the life of me, see what was wrong with this hotel except its location. It was clean, well presented and the staff, although a little gruff shall we say, were helpful. The hotel pool was a delight as was the pool bar and the bar staff. A welcome respite after the hectic sightseeing in Rome. Yes, the location leaves a lot to be desired but we knew this before we went and as soon as we sorted out which bus to get (they run very frequently) to the Metro, it was easy after that. The hotel evening meals were superb - we only intended to eat there the first night - and although we tried the restaurant just around the corner (don't bother) we found ourselves going back to the hotel on the last night as it was so good. If you want a full English breakfast, then don't expect one here - croissants and the usual continental fare were on offer - more than adequate. At no time did we see dirt either in the rooms, the dining area or anywhere else for that matter. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future - a shopping/restaurant complex is being built nearby which would be good news as it would give an alternative to just staying in the hotel to dine if you wanted to explore. Only one complaint, with the fabulous weather we had, it would have been nice to have a couple of chairs on our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: merthyrboy2
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews I was a little worried about our stay. My fears were however completely unfounded. The hotel was very smart with friendly helpful staff. Because it is out of town you get a 4 star hotel for the price of a 2 star or less in the city. A 3 day integrated bus and tube ticket is only 11 euros. The hotel is a 5 minute bus ride to the tube ( or a 20 minute walk ). The tube into the city takes about 20 minutes. Yes it is a little crowded and hot but hey its only 20 minutes. Very quiet at night. There is a lot of building going on around it but as we were sightseeing during the day it did not affect us. The restaurant is reasonably priced, the food not bad. Overall a very enjoyable stay and a hotel I would re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovecheesecake
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel outside of the city. Rooms are beautiful and look like a really expensive hotel room in Rome. Some people may be mislead because the outside of the hotel is kind of motelish but the rooms, especially the bathrooms are amazing. Dinner at the hotel was great and priced pretty good for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cristoforo Colombo was nice”
Reviews.Author: Cougarat
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews re this place and my experience was somewhat different. When I booked, I thought that this place was eons away from the centre of Rome but it was only a Metro or bus ride away. The hotel was clean and the breakfast, which was included was OK. The rooms had A/C so no complaints there. The walk to the Metro was only max 15 minutes away but the bus 714, from the sports stadium, to Termini was only 7-8 minutes walk away and allowed us to seen parts of Rome which we would not see otherwise. The main foyer was clean and nice and the restaurant, although we did not eat dinner, was fine. For a cheap holiday, it represented good value and once you know that information has to be asked for rather than freely given by the Italians, then you can understand the lack of maps and leaflets at the hotel. This was the same situation at some of the other hotels in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Nonna Sicilia
Reviews.Content: This was last hotel on our tour. It looks like a Motel 6. Its location is to far from the main sights of Rome. There is no eating areas so we we ate at the hotel. It has a varied menu but we did not care for the food. The staff was not that friendly. The area around hotel is not the cleanest and the road noise was bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not IN Rome!”
Reviews.Author: civil2006
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with beautiful rooms. The politeness of the staff was below average but that was not the problem. The problem is that the hotel is located outside near Rome's ring-road, meaning outside Rome's urban area. To go to the center you need to walk about 15 minutes to the last metro station (allthough you walk through a park and a lake which is nice). The you need 20 more minutes to get to the historical center. Overall, you have a cheap, nice hotel, outside Rome!

Reviews.Title: “you'll be sorry if you go here”
Reviews.Author: michelle-46
Reviews.Content: Got back today from a two night stay at this hotel. Read the reviews but have visited hotels before that had bad reviews and found them ok. The Hotel is flanked by two petrol stations, a road as busy as the M25 and two MASSIVE building sites, my heart sank as we pulled up outside it. We got the stupid early flight from stanstead and we got there about 10.30 and were informed our rooms were not ready (fair enough) but we couldn't get a cup of coffee or a drink till 5pm. The rooms were fine but the noise unbelievable, it even penetrated my earplugs! The building work started at 6.30 am!!!! The service was surly at best and though the room was fine I cannot think why anyone would recomMend this hotel I would rather stay on a park bench in central rome it would be friendlier and quieter. If you have booked here PLEASE change it now you are better off with a 2 star in central Rome save yourself the travel to town and get a good nights sleep! The company we were with were great and made what could have been a diasterous visit a good laugh thank god!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelbuster
Reviews.Content: Looking for a nice hotel in the urban parts of Rome this is a good choise. There are good communications by bus and metro to the central parts of the city. The pool is nice and the rooms are large. The only things that one can complain about is the cleanliness of the room. By an accident the bathtube in our room flooded and when we dryed the floor long black hair straws was catched in the towel. None of us has long black hair! But besides that: very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel but far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only negative factor about this hotel is the location and the fact that it is a far distant from the city centre. The hotel is isolated from near by shops and restaurants. The hotel itself, was nice and cosy and all staff were very helpful and friendly and were able to speak English which was a benefit. The room was cosy and clean with cleaners coming in everyday to clean the room. The hotel's restaurant, bar and pool were to standard. Overall i enjoyed my stay in this hotel and i would like to come and stay again in this hotel. However i must warn you, that it is far from the city centre and if willing to travel by metro or taxi as my friend and me did, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in Rome at the Cristoforo for one night. The hotel was desolate, far from the city center, and the room was filthy. The carpet had a variety of old spills, smudges, and LARGE stains. We were afraid to take off our shoes. We stayed in Italy for 2 weeks at a variety of other hotels and made it back to Rome for another couple of nights at a different hotel. For just 20 Euro more you can stay at a much better place and it is worth it. It's ridiculous that this hotel has 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: italytravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 20 min walk up a busy street to the Metro Stop EUR Palasport. This particular metro stop is on the same side of the street as the hotel, so you don't have to cross the lanes, though there are crosswalks with lights. This was a nice walk because there are lakes, villas and a different more modern side to Rome. The sign for the hotel and the outside of the hotel is kind of scary - reminded me of a road stop hotel like a days inn in the states, but the inside was very nice. The room had a TV with german, french, italian and CNN in english. The room was cleaned daily and was spotless upon arrival. There was a very large patio. The bathroom is nice with a large tub and very strong shower. There is a large closet. They provided one bath towel, but were very nice about giving us a second one on request and provided two towels from that point on. Since the hotel is outside of the main city, it is great for quiet sleeping. Everyone at the hotel was very nice to us, but note that they mainly speek Italian and German. They speak a little English. Check out was at noon which was great. The breakfast was sufficient and much nicer than most Italian hotels. It is served in a large breakfast room so there are alway enough tables serving rolls with jam, honey, chocolate, ham and cheese, little cakes, croissants, etc. The juice and coffee is not so fabulous so stick with tea and water. We heard so so things about this hotel, but for 75 Euros a night when every other 2 star hotel in the city was going for 115 Euros, we thought this was fantastic. We really recommend this hotel if you are a traveler on a budget, but you don't want to live like you are on a budget. For Italy, this is very much a 4 star hotel - the only downside is the location, but for the price, the walk is worth it. You can also take the 709 or 705 bus from right outside the hotel to the metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are comfortable and the staff were helpful and friendly. The problem with the hotel is its location to the centre of Rome. Getting buses and trains is difficult and time consuming and although within walking distance the road is extremely busy to cross and noisy. If you are staying here and taking advantage of excursions then it is fine but you have to be fit to walk to the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Electricdance
Reviews.Content: Was the hotel used by Trafalgar for the last night of Simple Italy tour. A week later we booked another 3 days there ourselves thru the internet (65 Euros a night, a good price we think) Tour groups are in the main building, low cost rooms in building 1. Clean, comfortable, and warm rooms staff helpful. No internet. Breakfast up to usual Italian standard for tourists. I'm being nice A good Bus/Metro ride to downtown, but we always enjoyed the ride (buskers especially) McDonalds at the Metro station, in case you need a change of pace from Italian food. Our room was next to the building site, but that was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “3 star NOT 4”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel clean and comfortable, but not 4 star. The food was average. Further away from the city centre than expected and along way from the airport. Had to use bus, metro and taxi to get from the airport to the hotel. Taxi expensive to travel from hotel to metro station. Metro service excellent- cheap but not very clean. Would stay again because of cleanliness however, location is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cstokely
Reviews.Content: First, let me say, this hotel is good for the price. We just want to share our experience so you'll know just what to expect for your money. Upon arrival, the place looks cheap, but don't be discouraged right away. Once you get into the lobby, it is nice and clean. The staff was nice, and helpful when asked, but not overly friendly. Our room was of adequate size (I've heard fairly large for a European hotel) and very clean. It had 2 twin beds, a balcony (not big enough for a morning breakfast, but nice enough to step outside for some morning air or a smoke or something), a color TV (only had 3 channels in English - MTV, CNN, BBC), a mini bar, a hair dryer, 2 plugs that had adapters build in, and an average size bathroom. Breakfast is included with your room. It's not great, but it is enough to get you started with your day. They had prosciutto and cheese, breads, a few cereals, milk, coffee (not the good kind -- from a single serving machine), teas, hot chocolate, red orange juice and pinapple juice. Dinner at the restaurant was very good (worth the money) but not outstanding. We did not try the room service. The main issue seems to be the location. I think we were in a business district but far from the heart of Rome. We were with a group, who luckily often bussed us to locations, but otherwise we opted for a cab. Be careful, learn how to ask "how much", and know it should be anywhere from 12 - 20 euros to get to your destination depending on where and traffic. Estimating 50 euro each day for transport, you're still much cheaper at this hotel than paying for one in town. I was told it was a hike to the metro or bus stops, but once you got the hang of it, it was much cheaper than a cab. You can buy passes for one or more days -- I think 3 days was 11 or 12 euro. We would probably not stay here next time we visit Rome, but have no regrets having stayed here this time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but not one to choose”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: The Colombo is the kind of hotel you would only stay in if you didn't know better. I stayed in the annex, which had the feeling of staying in a motel. The most shocking thing was the breakfast: orange juice made from concentrate in a plastic beaker, and an automatic coffee machine churning out brown gunk with a noise like a vacuum cleaner. They do offer coffee from the kitchen (still from a machine, but a better one!), but you have to ask. It may say it's 4 star, and they've invested in cheap but flashy furnishings to reinforce the impression, but it doesn't feel like you've stayed in a 4 star. Still, it is fairly clean, and my room's TV worked. If you get sent here by your airline when overbooked, then don't panic. But if can choose where to stay, then choose somewhere nice instead.

Reviews.Title: “extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: EmilyLars
Reviews.Content: We were treated horribly at this hotel. We made our reservation 2 weeks in advance and they only told us once we'd arrived that they had to move us to another hotel because they were full. The man at the front desk was extremely rude and condescending to us (4 college students) even though he was our age. The hotel they put us in was not as nice but they made us pay full price for it. Stay anywhere but here, seriously, anywhere

Reviews.Title: “Weddings Get Priority - Not Guests”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pool closed without warning Evening meals cancelled for weddings Breakfast totally self service - dirty table cloths - coffee and fruit juice appalling Rooms fine Construction outside - noisy Meals appalling - local restaurant good. Crossing roads to goto bus/metro - dangerous Incorrect info given by staff re getting to airport - suggested it would cost us as much to use public transport - in reality - quite accessible by metro and train combined. 3 star at best

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiaLimerick
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start on our arrival in Rome, we got a cab from the airport to Hotel Cristforo Columbo and we were ripped off, we were charge 65 euros for a 15 min drive. it turned out that we didnt get the legal cabs but sure we didnt know any different...but be warned only get the panda type cabs. Our first impressions when we arrived at the hotel (after we got over the shock of the price of the cab) was that it looked like a motel, very plain, on entering the reception we were pleased, all marble and clean. the staff were ok but not overly friendly. our room was very small but clean and the en-suite was tiny. all marble but nothing fancy. the hotel was situated on an extremely busy highway, we had to stick our heads out around the side of a bush to see if there was any traffic coming and make a run for it if there wasnt. the hotel was very far away from everything, its about a 5 min walk to the bus, then on the bus for about 5 mins to get to the metro, depending on what stop you want to get off on you could be on the metro for about an hour!! it was 40degrees most days and theres no air conditioning on the metro....its really overcrowded and it turned us off going anywhere towards the end of our hols. the food in the hotel is ok, nothing fancy but there is a lovely restaurant around the corner. we also went to a hotel accross the road where the beer is cheaper and better choice, in Cristoforo they only had 1 type of beer costing 5 euors each!! one day the restaurant was closed and the breakfast was moved to another part of the hotel, it turned out that it was for a private party! a wedding was being held in the restaurant and the pool was also closed (without a warning), we thought it was ridulous, we paid good money to use the facilities and for this to happen was maddness. we had to spend the rest of the day in our room as it was too hot to do anything else and by that time we were sick of being on the metro. we didnt even go into Rome city centre at night as we heard the metro was too dangerous to travel at night and the taxi's were way too expensive. Overall i wouldnt recommed this hotel, i'd rather pay more money to stay in a more central hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Practical but far from a real "4 stars" hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Cristoro Colombo and we had chosen this hotel because we planned our holidays quite late and it was the last to offer rather cheap rooms (60 euros). Nothing to say about the price, which is definitely underneath all "4 * hotels", but maybe we would have been very dispointed if we had payed the regular price (which is around 200 euros !). Indeed, you cannot consider the services as a those of the class it pretends to belong. First, the location is really really poor and far from city center. Subway is more that 1 km away and taking the bus to go there is a real pain ! Rooms are clean and big enough, just regular without any character. Don't expect to have any fancy view ! The breakfast is unworthy of a so called 4* hotel, that mean self service to a coffee machine and fruit juice, dry bread, and some cakes. And it closes à 9.30 AM (by turning off the light of room !). There is also no business center or even an Internet point (the only answer was : "you have to go out", but there is nothing around except cars, express ways and fiels with trucks). Service is simply present and polite but nothing more. Finally, I would not recommend this adress, except if you haven't any other solution, and if you can have a real good price, as we did. But there is a little good point : in the EUR (the suburb near the hotel 20min by walking) you can find a branch of Giolitti, the best ice-cream maker of Rome, so this area is not a total desert !

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 10 day holiday staying at the Cristoforo Colombo Hotel and loved it. We arrived there quite late at night and the staff were very welcoming. They could see that we couldn't speak a word of Italian, and spoke very good English to us, but as the holiday progressed a simple ciao, or grazie from us went a long way! The hotel is situated near a busy motorway, but as long as you are careful and use the crossings on the road with confidence, you have nothing to worry about! Our room was great. Although some people have mentioned that they were too small, we didn't think so. After all, we didn't travel all the way from the Shetland Isles to sit in a hotel room! We had everything we needed...two beds, a bathroom with shower, tv, electronic safe, wardrobe space,a fridge which came in very handy after a very hot day in the city! A good idea is to buy in soft drinks/water from the supermarket across the road and then you'll always have a supply of something cool when you arrive back after a long day!) Our balcony was very spacious with the sun beaming in from mid day to sun set. Although at present there is some construction work in the site opposite our room, the sound proofing in our room was amazing, cutting out so much of the noise. The hotel staff are very helpful, and will give you directions into the centre of Rome. There is a bus to the metro station across the road, but it is only a 10-15 minute walk up Via Cristoforo Colombo to the Palasport metro station, once you walk over the bridge and go down the steps, it's right there. We bought a "BIG" ticket (unlimited use on the bus, underground, train) which was only 4 euros and lasted until midnight, but there are many other tickets you can buy to suit your touring needs. Although the pool is not very big, many Roman hotels don't have this luxury and it is very handy on a hot summers day! There is a pool bar which offers shade from the sizzling sun and refreshing drinks from mid afternoon onwards. A nice place to sit and reflect upon your day when you return to the hotel in the evening. The Pizzeria along the road is excellent, has friendly staff and menus written in English (which is good for the likes of me who can't read anything more than "spaghetti" "ravioli" and "pizza" in Italian!) We found that we were able to recognise more and more words as time went on, using a simple phrase book to guide us! I would recommed this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind being a little bit out of the city, enjoys experiencing different modes of transport and who isn't looking for a place to simply to sit and relax for the entire holiday, as the traffic nearby is very busy and can be quite distracting at times.

Reviews.Title: “Too much travelling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay, the rooms are small but reasonable the staff helpful, however transport is certainly an issue. This hotel is not in the centre of Rome it is located in a southern suburb known as the EUR. This would not be a problem if it was next to a Metro line, IT IS NOT. You have to cross a six lane highway and walk about 5 minutes to the bus stop, here you have to wait until a bus takes you to the metro (another 5-10 minute journey, or 15-20 minute walk if you don't fancy the bus). You then have to travel about 20 minutes on the metro until you hit Termini in the centre of Rome. THen considering you have a 20-30 minute walk til you get to Piazza Navonna and the heart of rome you can imagine it is a lot of time wasted getting to places. This is all made much more difficult from the fact that the bus, certainly when I was there, very rarely turned up within 20 minutes and once was as long as 50 minutes. You can find yourself having spent an 1hour to an hourand half just getting somewhere, very frustrating espeically with so much to see. I recommend that if you don't mind travelling then stay here, it is cheap and cheerful and good value for what it provides. However it is possible to get much cheaper and more convenient hotels around the Termini area which would then cut out the time consuming problem of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Advantages”
Reviews.Author: CKMorison
Reviews.Content: My wife Kate and I had a wonderful time in Rome, and we enjoyed the area of Cristoforo Colombo for evening meals. Good Points 1. The hotel reception staff were friendly and helpful (one lady was a bit lethargic, but on the whole, the staff were good) 2. The room was air-conditioned, large and had a nice bathroom. 3. The swimming pool was nice. 4. The bar adjacent to the pool was nice, with friendly staff. 5. The Hotel was not expensive. 6. A bus or short walk to Eur Ferma Metro Station (15 minute walk) was very pleasant. Excellent Point 1. Around the corner is the most fantastic restaurant called I Destrieri where the food was good, the service was excellent, the staff friendly, and all at a reasonable price. There are three enclosed areas and an Al Fresco area, where my wife and I spent all 7 evenings. Bad Points. 1. The Hotel gave preference to private parties and we found the restaurant, pool and bar closed for a good deal of the time. 2. The private party over the weekend was loud so earplugs might be advisable. 3. Breakfast was average, but edible. Alternative to the above was that we could walk to I Destrieri when these private parties were going on. Safety Warning. 1. Be careful when walking out of the hotel exit as vehicles from the main road can turn in quite sharply. I was almost knocked down on one occasion. The advise is to keep firmly to the left near the bushes, and slowly peek left when you reach the end of the drive. Overall. My wife and I were very happy, and the good points outweighed the bad. We will stay there again, especially as Restaurant 'I Destrieri' is so close by.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore all the negative reviews. This hotel is brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the miserable reviews you read about this hotel on this site. My boyfriend and I stayed her for four nights at the start of July, and we thought it was great! Rooms small? Yes, but you don't really go to Rome to stay in your hotel room the whole time do you? They are clean and comfortable, and ours had a great shower! there is a small balcony, and you can put the chairs from the room out side, so if you need to smoke in the room, you can do it out there. The Hotel IS situated on a busy highway, but there are plently of pedestrian walkways for you to safely cross the road. Transport links bad? No. Bus stop literally across the road, and this takes you straight to the metro station where you can be in the centre in 20 minutes. and the shop in the hotel (Shangri La) next to it sells the travel cards. No good restuarants? Try the five star hotel the Shangri La Resturant. quite expensive, but excellent food in a lovely pool-side setting. Or.... stay on the same side if the road as the cristoforo hotel, go past the petro station and car yard and you'll find a very pleasant ristorante/pizzeria with friendly staff, not to mention more excellent food. They even served us at ten minutes to midnight on our last night when we came home late from the centre. They also have great kareoke in the evenings if you want to brush up on your italian pop music! There is also a snack bar in a petrol staion towards the metro staion to which was great. Unhelpful and non english speaking staff? We found the staff to be very pleasant, and helped us out with places to go in the centre and gave us a small map for the metro and bus numbers etc. They even called us a taxi to go back to the airport. As for speaking english... remember we are in their country. If you make a little effort in Italian, such as hello, please, thank you etc, it goes a long way and they will make the effort back. Pool is great too with free towels and a bar open in the evening. The last amazing thing I will tell you. directly next door to the hotel there is a man with a van who arrives in the evening and parks in the petrol station. he sells freshly cooked sausages, meat filled panninis and all sorts of italian snacks. He also sells bottles of beer and soft drinks. Very handy if you arrive at the hotel at midnight.... or fancy a late night beer. and he is there till six am!

Reviews.Title: “not bad not great”
Reviews.Author: raiderfan21
Reviews.Content: i would agree with resent posts on this hotel , we stayed for a week the location is a long way from downtown it is a good 25 min walk to the metro (metro safe and easy to use better than the london underground ) the roads just outside are very busy but passable with care , the rooms are small by US standards ,but clean and tidy as with the bathroom ,breakfast is ok ,the problem we had ,with a longer stay we didnt want to march out early every morning so after 9.30am theres no food avaliable till 7.30pm theres no drinks till 5.00 ish ( except mini bar ) and pool didnt open till midday ? the staff though were freindly and helpful in all areas , restaurant food was good and fair price for rome ! the hotel is really a coach tour stop over not for longer stays . PS thay started a major construction project at the back of the hotel so iam not if the traffic drowns out the noise of the building or vise versa. if you would like more detail please send emails to pmiles21@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Folks, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable, yet affordable place to sleep in, after a long day sightseeing in Rome, this is it. If you are looking for a five star resort, where you spend all your day in and get pampered, this is not the place. I had read so many scary reviews of the cheaper places in Rome, that I almost changed my mind about going to Rome. This hotel is a place I would definitely go back to, if I ever go back to Rome (which I probably will). Negatives: - Its parking lot exit is right next to a busy road. You need to be careful if you are walking out of the parking lot. - The walk to the metro station is a pleasant one, but it is 25 minutes long. I suggest you take a taxi to your destination anyway. Taxi's are not that expensive, specially if there are more than 2 people sharing them. There are many minivan type taxi's in Rome which fit 6 people very comfortably. Positives: - It is clean. None of that sewer smell stuff you hear about other hotels. - It is quite. You won't even know if there is anyone in the next room. - Very nice shower with strong water flow (water temperature fluctuates a bit...). - Continental breakfast. Nothing fancy, but decent enough. - Air conditioning. - TV with some English speaking channels. - In-room programmable safe. Again, if you are the spoiled type with lots of demands, do yourself a favour and pay 300-500 euros a night and stay somewhere else. If not, stay here and pay less than 100 euros per night (we were there at the end of May, 2005). It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “We did our research.... and loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on this site, did some basic research of our own and came to the conclusion that this would be a good hotel for us. We weighed up issues of value for money versus proximity to the city center and decided that we as we would only be using any hotel as a place to sleep and eat breakfast we would go for the most economical option. In our opinion the Cristoforo Colombo more than delivered. Yes the hotel is on a busy street, but there are crosswalks and neither we nor our fellow Cristoforo Colombo residents heading into Rome seemed to encounter any difficulties there. The bus stops are very close by and while the metro station is a little further away it should also be walk-able for most. Like an earlier reviewer, we too spent a longer than planned evening in Rome city center and ended up having to get a taxi back from the city center. (It turns out a taxi ride in Rome is not to be missed!) It only cost 15 Euros but then he did drive extra fast! We found the breakfasts to be perfectly adequate. There were coach parties using the hotel who tend to 'swamp' the breakfast room at set times, but the breakfast supplies keep arriving from the kitchens so the buffet table was regularly replenished. Many of the city center accomodations we investigated for a similar price didn't offer breakfast at all. The weather was very warm particularly during the first few days of our stay and the swimming pool was wonderful after a hot day's sightseeing. There are not many city center hotels with swimming pools! This was a luxury we really enjoyed. Our room was very well furnished and the bathroom was particularly plush. The rooms are certainly smaller than many American hotels, but very tastefully furnished and clean. There was also an electronic safe in the room.
