We ate one evening meal in the hotel, it was pleasant enough, but there is a better local restaurant just around the corner from the hotel offering anything from pizzas to full meals. We found the staff at the hotel to be polite. The rooms do lack information leaflets/brochures, but the reception staff we talked to were happy to direct us to the bus stops, the swimming pool etc and they also booked the taxi for our return trip to the airport. We we worried about pickpockets in Rome but didn't encounter any security issues anywhere, but then again you must take responsibilty for your own property. Why risk leaving a purse or handbag for a few seconds in any hotel anywhere, not just the Cristoforo Colombo? In our opinion this hotel was good value for money, but this obviously depends on your priorities. This hotel probably wouldn't be a good choice for those with mobility problems or possibly those with small children who might want to take mid day breaks. For those on a serious sightseeing agenda, who don't mind taking public transit for a half hour, this hotel comes strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a BIG favor !!! Do Not Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, I made a mistake by picking this hotel before reading enough reviews. "Rookie Mistake" #1. I ask for a smoking room. Nope, Didn't happen. There are no chairs on the small balcony to sit in and enjoy the view of the front lobby door while enjoying a smoke. There are no brochures of any kind in the room. There is no check out label on the back of the door stating fire info. etc.. There are no vending or ice machines. There is nothing close by to visit. You have to literally risk your life crossing one of the busiest streets to catch a bus that will not stop in front of the hotel. We ask for a taxi to take us to some souvenior shops and were dropped of at a modern/expensive shopping mall and left stranded in the rain. My wife was in tears and swore she would never return. No one would call us a taxi from the hotel and they were very rude. The swimming pool was unbarebly cold. We stayed one day and that was enough for us. We were charged for the two days we had booked in advance and it was worth it not to have to stay any longer. Forget the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price..So So Location”
Reviews.Author: JuiceJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night as we were leaving from Rome the next day. The location was a bit further than expected and took some time to finally find it; even the locals were confused where it was. When we arrived it looked like a Motel 6 but upon checking into the room we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean and we did eat dinner at the restaurant which we belived for Rome was moderately priced..everything is expensive in Rome! I would suggest if you want to save money and do the long commute every day then go for it...otherwise spend a little more money and be closer to the Eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a good place to stay if you want to really see all of Rome. It's location is more closer to the airport and you'd need to spend sometime to really get the hang of the bus system, or spend lots on a Taxi. Not too many resturants in the area as well and the one at the hotel is very expencive. We stayed there because that is where our tour booked us, and they use it mainly because it's close to the airport. If you really want to enjoy Rome, then find a place close to the Spanish Steps or the Train Station. Staying here is like staying at any ol' hotel, but hey your in Rome, so stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cristoforo Colombo for 2 nights in May of 2003 with my husband and 5 year old son. When we first got there we were a bit put off by the appearance. It looked very plain, like a motel, not the way it looked on website. But the lobby was beautiful, the restaurant was gorgeous, and the rooms were immaculate. It was a little small, but it worked! My son loved the terrace with a view of a field of goats, and donkeys! Yes, in Europe you get two twin beds instead of a Queen, but that's the norm. Just push them together. There was one woman at the desk who wasn't the friendliest, but the rest of the staff was wonderful. The breakfast buffet was good, fresh and convenient.(fruit, croissants, bread, cereal, cheese, priosciutto) We lived in Italy for 4 years, so we've seen a lot of European hotels, and this place was phenomenal for the price! We payed almost twice the price for a dump in Milan. It was a little far from the center of town, but we drove, so it was okay. I wouldn't advise driving if you've never driven in Europe. People don't always heed the traffic signals, and mopeds and bikes rule the road! Take the metro. If you want something closer, with the same standards, expect to pay a LOT more! Overall our stay was quite pleasant! If we went back, we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had already booked our stay at Cristoforo Columbo, before we found this review site. The difference in price saved by staying here was just too good to pass up. ($63 U.S. during 1st week of March) After reading some of the reviews here, we were a little apprehesive, but later reviews looked more favorable, so we were a bit relieved. We are glad we picked the Cristoforo Columbo, instead of paying more to stay a bit closer to the city! This was a great place to stay for the price! Definately 4 star!!!! The lobby was fabulous and the dinning room spacious & elegant. The entire hotel was very clean looking. The room was very nice and tastefully decorated, with lots of marble in the bathroom. (stick key card in wall mount by door to make lights come on- LOL) We noticed no problems between the staff and others and they seemed very friendly & helpful whenever we interacted with them. Having free breakfast included was very helpful. It was your typical Continental type breakfast. Enough varity to satisfy different people and the food was good. Evening dining in the restaurant was expensive. We used the Bus & Metro system to get around and it was no problem at all. 5 min walk to the bus stop or 15 min walk to Metro station. We rode the bus to the Fermi Metro station. (crossing the road to the bus stop was no problem if you are careful- cross road and bus stop is 200 ft ahead) We bought train & subway passes when we first got there, then noticed that nobody uses them. We eventually did as the Romans did and quit buying passes also. (LOL) If you are not shy, just get on the train at the airport, then buses or subways without buying a ticket. (on subway just follow everyone else who walks on through the gate) You will soon see what I'm talking about. (nobody asks for a ticket) The "A" subway line closes at 9 PM, so if you get caught out after it closes, just go to a bus stop and find a bus that will get you to one of the "B" subway line stops. The "B" is open until midnight, so if you get on by 11 PM, you can take it to the Fermi stop and ride bus 706 back in time. (make sure you get off at the bus stop before the big intersection of Cristoforo Columbo & Atlantico- second stop on Atlantico) All the attractions were close enough by taking the Metro to make it worthwile to stay at Hotel Cristoforo Columbo, because of the great low price. We had a very positive experience staying here and would stay here again for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie, Grazie, Grazie!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here form 4 February to 14 February 2005. We rented a car and found the parking a real plus for Rome. We had read the reviews and were very concerned about the hotel prior to arriving. I had even made two seperate reservations through Hotels in case it was as bad as we were led to believe. We arrived early on our flight from the US and were told we would have to wait awhile to check in. We made ourselves comfortable in the spacious lobby. Within 10 minutes the front desk staff called us and had our room ready. We were fast asleep for our morning nap by noon. We used the hotel for our base during the vacation We made many day trips to the fantastic sites off the beaten path. When we went into the city center we drove to the car parking at the metro station and took the metro in. We have limited distance left in our legs so walking that extra 1/2 mile to the Metro would not have been good. We ended up staying all 10 days. For $59 a night we did not feel bad when we stayed a night in Amalfi, because it was so beautiful there. We were able to drive into Rome on Saturday and Sunday and park by the Vatican City. This was our 7th trip to Rome and the hotel far beyond our expectations. If you are only going to be in Rome for a couple of days, the added expense of a city center hotel is advised. If you have more time then money this is a great hotel! The staf was Troppo Gentile!

Reviews.Title: “4 star rooms and reception staff, 0 stars restaurant and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Adrian46
Reviews.Content: Accomodation:Hotel rooms, reception, reception and bar staff excellent definitly 4 star. Breakfast: terrible, 3 mornings was enough! Restaurant: service very-very slow and staff disinterested. Rome approx 25-30 minutes by bus and metro (4 euros all day anywhere ticket) Only paid £29 per room B&B per night (expedia), if restaurant was ok it would have been worth treble

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Low Price, Medium Brekfast, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It is very cheap if you book it over internet (normal price 220EUR for double room). Rooms are small, one would espect bigger room in a 4 star hotel, but big enough for a couple of days, even for longer if you're interested in staying in the city for most of the day, and not spending your vacation in the hotel room. Very clean. Bathroom is excellent, all marble, totally new furnished. The whole hotel looks new and fresh. There is also outdoor pool. Pleasantly suprised. Breakfast: quantities are large but there is only basic food (one type of cheese, one salami, some spreads, three types of cereals, two types of juice, two type of cake). Location: eays to find. From city center: Metro B direction Laurentina, station EUR Fermi, take bus in front of Metro station number 70,71,706 or 709. You'll need two-three stations with the bus, or walk south down Via Cristoforo Colombo for 15 min (on a fine day, an easy walk). Make sure you get of the bus before the big crossroad (you'll see signs of hypermarket "Standa", clothes shop "Oviesse" or hotel sign), the next station after that one is 2km away, if you miss it, get off (don't forget to ring the busdriver, otherwise he will not stop) at next station, go below highway, and take the same bus back). The hotel is just behind AGIP petrol station. Bus ticket is 1 EUR (BIT ticket, valid for 75 min). Coming from airport: Take regular train (5 EUR) to station "Ostiense", go across the square to metro B direction Laurentina (see above). Train goes every 15 mins. There is a faster train (just doesnt stop before city center) which costs 9,5 EUR, get off at station "Termini" and then same as above. It takes about 1/2 hour to get to city center from hotel. For the price it is worth it. IF you see gipsies in the Metro, begging for money and playing music, just ignore them, they will go away. Be reasonably cautious about your bellongings, there are lots of pickpockets in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Stay...Great Price. Before I went on my trip, I read the reviews at this site and was a little worried about how my stay was goig to be. First, all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived before noon and despite their strict check-in times, they immediately got our room ready and checked us in. And everytime we walked through the lobby, I was greeted by name. Second, there is a busy road outside of the hotel. But there are also cross-walks with signal lights, that make it very easy to cross the street. Third, the train station is 1km away (just over 1/2 a mile). We walked every day. It took about 15-20 min., and we usually arrived back at the hotel the same time the bus did. Fourth, It is a long ride on the train to get to the Vatican City (the hotel is almost at the end of it's line), but there are plenty of other stops with things to see on the way. When you first arrive, just get a multi-pass. It cost us 11 euro each. That gave us unlimited use for 3 days. And last, the nearest hotel is right around the corner from the hotel and has great food at good prices. It is 50 meters from the hotel and doesn't require you to cross any streets. If you are looking for a great hotel at a bargain price, this is it. The trade off for the price is the distance from downtown. We felt it was worth the trade.

Reviews.Title: “indiffirent staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was part of the cosmos tour which visited europe during the first two weeks of october. we've been to many hotels as part of the coach tour. most of these hotels are smaller than cristoforo colombo but cristoforo definitely got a very bad rating from our tour group. the reason: members of the groups were robbed while we were having breakfast on the second day of our stay. (you can verify this with the police based in florence because that is where our tourmates were told to go.) how it happened? we were in the breakfast area of the hotel for our breakfast. seeing that the hotel already cordoned off the area for our group, some group members placed their bags on the tables to get their breakfast. it was so swift, a tourist-looking guy entered the area, got breakfast and appeared to be heading towards the other tourist groups. in a flash, bags were taken. members of the group immediately called the staff's attention, and not one of them exerted effort to check possible exit points. the tour director also demanded that they see the security camera shots and was refused. efforts by the group to contact the local police was snubbed because they say that since it is involves tourists, it falls under the national police's discretion. the group was forced to leave for florence where the reports were filed. if security is important to you, don't go to cristoforo colombo

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Four Star Hotel with various problems ie Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 18/09/04 - 22/09/04 This hotel accommodation is up to the four star standard but however there were three problems with this hotel 1) Location - we walked to the metro which took aobut 20 mins and then got on the tube this was another 20 mins The websites also stated that the various attractions are close by but this is not true unless you are willing to drive!!!!! The maps on these websites are useless as they say the hotel is only 500 metres walking distance it was probably twice or if not three times that up hill!!! 2) Meals - Breakfast - the same thing everyday no variety (we've stayed in 2/3 star city break hotels and they've had a fantastic buffet with lots of choice) Dinner - first of all we arrived and were told we could not eat in the restaurant as they had a wedding so we had to try and find a restaurant, which we did across the road and it was lovely and then when we did eat in the hotel restaurant we had to book and it certainly wasnt worth the hassle as the main emphasis was on veal or beef and no traditional main meals!!!! As stated on previous feedback the evening meal times are ridiculous as once you've got to the hotel you obviously want to freshen up from a day's sight seeing, also on the websites it is stated that Room Service is offered but there is no information within your rooms that gives you this option. 3) Customer Service - the only person that seemed polite was the lady (sorry didnt know her name) the rest of the staff looked liked they should be working in Fawlty Towers not a four star hotel. If you want a cheap break then this hotel is worth the money but I certainly would pay a bit extra and stay in a hotel closer to the Metro or in the heart of city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oasisck
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews of this hotel, I was more than a little apprehensive about my impending holiday. Please dont be put off. The hotel is fantastic, very clean rooms, (I think it is quite new) and the pool was a bonus many central Rome hotels dont offer. Yes it takes about 20 minutes to reach the centre but the savings on the room make the travel well worth it since even taxi's arent all that expensive, and the public transport is excellent. Additionally, due to Rome being a top tourist destination, many of the city centre hotels look pretty run down so dont be fooled by the claims they are "well appointed central hotels." Cristoforo Colombo is next to a busy road but there are pedestrian crossings and we stayed for 2 weeks and never once had trouble crossing the road. I've read on some reviews the road takes half an hour to cross (were these people crawling?!!) Rome is the sort of city that you need to take the metro to many of the attractions anyway, so staying on for an extra couple of stops to get to and from the hotel was no great hardship. We met loads of people in the hotel and not 1 person seemed dissatisfied with their choice of hotel. All in all, I would definitely go back. The short journey to Rome is nothing compared to how cheap you can stay in this great hotel. If your older, or less mobile then you may want to consider something a little closer, but if you are young and active this is the hotel for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “4-Star hotel? You must be Joking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, dont let the picture listed for this hotel fool you. It was taken at night (to make it look nicer) and the angle which it is taken from has to be a photo-trick. When we first arrived at the hotel, we were not greeted with faces of joy - but ones of sorrow. The staff just did not seem bothered to see us. Someone needs to do some hands on training with the staff as they need to learn how to smile once in a while and welcome their guests - it doesnt require a degree in hotel and hospitality management to be welcoming to guests. Then theres the room - All beds are single and they only join them up to make a double. The rooms are resonably sized with an ok looking bathroom. However, If bathrooms are important to you though, like it is for me - dont come here. The restaurant is joke and the waiter who has probably been working there for at least 27 years, gave us some of the worst service I have ever experienced. Breakfast starts at 6:30am and finishes at 9:30am. This is supposed to be a holiday not a boarding school! It needed to be longer than that. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the centre of Rome and the bus (the 714) is always there. Thats If you can get to the bus stop. Getting out of the hotel is like a death-trap. Because its beside an extremely busy highway, it should take you about 30 minutes to cross one side. My advice is: dont come here unless you want bad service and journey to get into rome. Stay closer to the centre instead, its just not worth it, even if it is under the sought after £400.
